node.title: Leading Māori legal academic Moana Jackson dies
node.description: Moana Jackson, one of the country's leading legal minds and indigenous scholars, has died after a lengthy illness.

node.title: Brian Laundrie's parents move to dismiss lawsuit brought by Gabby Petito's family
node.description: Laundrie was found dead in a Florida nature reserve last fall, several weeks after his fiancée's body was discovered in a Wyoming national park, where the couple had been vacationing.

node.title: Review of Will Smith Oscars slap "will take a few weeks," Academy president says
node.description: The Academy's president and CEO said they are "upset and outraged" by Will Smith's behavior.

node.title: Carl Icahn calls out Kroger on treatment of workers and animals
node.description: The billionaire activist investor takes his fight over the treatment of pigs to the nation's biggest grocery chain.

node.title: Leading Māori lawyer Moana Jackson dies
node.description: Leading Māori lawyer Moana Jackson, a forceful advocate for criminal justice reform, has died after a lengthy illness.

node.title: Meet Viktor: Elliot Page's "Umbrella Academy" character comes out
node.description: Season 3 of "The Umbrella Academy" is set to premiere on June 22.

node.title: Where senators stand on Ketanji Brown Jackson's Supreme Court nomination
node.description: One Republican, Sen, Susan Collins, has announced she will support Jackson's nomination to the Supreme Court.

node.title: Leisure travel soars, at a cost to consumers
node.description: Airline ticket prices are up, up and away, with consumers who pushed off trips during the pandemic clamoring for flights just when jet fuel costs are rising.

node.title: Young men are earning less than young women in some big cities
node.description: Despite the progress for some young women, the gender pay gap is still dominant across much of the U.S. — and worsens when women have kids.

node.title: Edmunds: Should you fix your car — or buy a new one?
node.description: As car prices continue to hit records, the answer will depend on your vehicle's age, what's broken and your tolerance for uncertainty.

node.title: CDC drops its recommendation against cruise ship travel
node.description: Health agency had previously advised Americans to avoid cruise ships because of COVID-19 risks.

node.title: Seniors around the world are biking through cycling program
node.description: "When you take a 101-year-old woman for a bike ride and she holds your hand tight and says thank you and gives you a kiss on the cheek, it doesn't get any better than that," John Seigle Boettner said.

node.title: TikToker's old phone lets her post from behind Russia's "iron curtain"
node.description: "No one is actually reporting from inside the country," Natalia told CBS News. But she discovered, thanks to some outdated cell phone software, that she could.

node.title: Putin feels Russian military misled him, U.S. official says
node.description: The U.S. intelligence community has concluded that Putin was unaware his military was using - and losing - conscripts in Ukraine.

node.title: Mortgage rates are rising faster than they have in a decade
node.description: With interest rates now at 4.8%, today's homebuyers might have to pay an extra $300 per month on a 30-year mortgage.

node.title: Possible tornado in Arkansas injures 7, destroys elementary school building
node.description: Damaging wind gusts, intense tornadoes and thunderstorms are forecast for parts of the Mid-South into the central Gulf Coast.

node.title: School looks at its history in bid to move on from 'outdated' block names
node.description: A Taranaki school's decision to test opinion on changing the names of its classroom blocks has caused a stir.

node.title: Biden expected to end Title 42 border expulsion policy in late May
node.description: U.S. immigration officials have carried out over 1.7 million expulsions of migrants in the past two years under the policy.

node.title: Video shows powerful tornado destroying Texas school's gym
node.description: Video footage from a surveillance camera shows what it was like inside a Texas elementary school's gymnasium as it was being destroyed by a powerful tornado.

node.title: "The Wanted" singer Tom Parker dies after battle with brain tumor
node.description: "Our hearts were broken, Tom was the centre of our world and we can't imagine life without his infectious smile and energetic presence," his wife said on Instagram.

node.title: Barcelona to host America's Cup
node.description: Barcelona will host the next America's Cup.

node.title: Trump has endorsed nearly 130 candidates for 2022, testing his influence in the Republican Party
node.description: Trump last week pulled his endorsement of Mo Brooks in Alabama due to Brooks' poor polling.

node.title: Everything you bought last year now costs about $5,200 more
node.description: Fiercest inflation in decades means a typical family now needs to budget an extra $433 a month, analysis shows.

node.title: Mackenzie District tourism businesses '100 percent ready for action'
node.description: Bookings are steadily streaming into businesses in the Mackenzie District ahead of borders reopening next month.

node.title: Timeline: Transmission Gully's 103-year history
node.description: It's been decades in the making and today Transmission Gully has finally opened. RNZ looks at the long road to get here.

node.title: Solomons' leader confirms security pact with China
node.description: Solomon Islands Prime Minister Mannaseh Sogavare has confirmed his government has finalised a security treaty with China.

node.title: 'Mistakes were made': Army assures improvements after Molotov cocktail incident
node.description: The Defence Force says it will learn from a mistake that saw three soldiers burned in a training exercise gone wrong. Audio

node.title: 'Our op shops are drowning in second hand clothes'
node.description: There are growing calls for the government to introduce viable ways people can recycle clothing in order to tackle the country's growing waste crisis. Audio

node.title: 'Real turning point': Wind and solar now supply 10% of world electricity
node.description: Wind turbines and solar panels produced 10 percent of global electricity in 2021 but coal also had a resurgence.

node.title: Blocking consent for more helipads not possible, council planners say
node.description: Planners at Auckland Council are resisting calls for a clampdown on helipads on the eve of a key meeting, amid whirling discontent in the Hauraki Gulf.
